fieldData.title: Temporary unemployment premium for employees in the metal sector
fieldData.title_nationalLanguage: Aanvullende uitkering in kader van Covid-19 voor werknemers uit de metaalsector (PC 209 en PC 111)
fieldData.descriptionBackgroundInfo: Both white collar and blue collar employees in the metal sector (joint commitees 209 for white collar and 111 for blue collars) receive an additional premium on top of their economic unemployment benefits that is related to the COVID-19 crisis and/or any of the measures implemented by the government (for example, closures).
fieldData.descriptionContentOfMeasure: The premium amounts to €12.07 per day for full-time employees within the sector and €6.04 per day for part-time employees. The premium is in addition to the general economic unemployment due to COVID-19 as well as the additional premium of €5.63 that is paid out by the Federal Unemployment Services and applicable to all employees that fall under the measure (regardless of sector).For white collar workers the payment is done by the employer in question, which can recuperate half of the amount from the Social Funds for Employees in the metal sector. Blue collar workers receive the amount automatically through the trade union.
fieldData.descriptionUseOfMeasure: The exact uptake for the specific sector is unknown.
fieldData.descriptionInvolvementOfSocialPartners: The agreement was negotiated and signed within the relevant joint committees. So it was entirely the competence of the social partners within the sector.
